title: Understanding Beer's Law
text: Beer's Law is a fundamental principle in absorption spectroscopy. It relates the absorbance of light to the properties of the material through which the light is traveling.

title: Components of Beer's Law
text: Beer's Law can be expressed as $$A=\varepsilonlc$$, where A is the absorbance, ε is the molar absorptivity, l is the path length, and c is the concentration of the solution.

hintAnswer: Absorbance is directly proportional to concentration
title: Direct Proportionality
text: According to Beer's Law, how does absorbance relate to concentration?
choices: Absorbance is directly proportional to concentration
Absorbance is inversely proportional to concentration
Absorbance is proportional to the square of concentration

title: Molar Absorptivity
text: The molar absorptivity (ε) is a constant that indicates how strongly a substance absorbs light at a particular wavelength.

title: Path Length
text: The path length (l) is the distance that light travels through the solution, typically measured in centimeters.

title: Practical Application
text: In practice, you can determine the concentration of an unknown solution by measuring its absorbance and using a calibration curve or Beer's Law equation.
